column2: A form of Islam native to the Indian subcontinent. Ahmadi Muslims believe that a messianic figure known as the Mahdi, named Ahmad, came down to India before the Event, announcing that the people must repent and turn back to the True Islam, or else be destroyed. To those who accepted him he showed the new way of peace, and proclaimed that Islam would no longer be spread by the sword, but by more peaceful means. To those who rejected him, he issued condemnations. The Event then fell upon the people for their lack of faith, while the chosen people remained safe, hidden from the wrath. Now, under the guidance of their Caliph, the Ahmadiyya go forth once again, to preach the religion of peace to every corner of the ruined world.

Sarnaism is a folk religion practised primarily by the Kurukh and Munda peoples and spread throughout the Chota Nagpur plateau in eastern India. Claiming to be an ancient belief system existing since time immemorial, Sarnaism, known locally as Sarna Dhorom and to outsiders as the Religion of the Holy Woods, is a nature worshipping pagan faith largely detached from surrounding Hindu and Abrahamic religions. Though syncretism is commonplace, Sarnaists reject the Varna system and ignore any foreign religious texts, instead turning inwards, focusing on protecting and nurturing the nature around them. Having a vast and inconsistent amount of deities and spirits, the most frequently worshipped supreme creator is the Sun, known as Dharmes, a force of unquestionable good. The sacred Sarna grove is of especial importance, and it is believed the groves are the abode of Chala Pachchho, a powerful female deity commonly identified as a mother goddess of earth and nature. Once a year Sarnaists observe the Sarhul festival, a three day period of celebration in which adherents celebrate marriage between the Earth and the Sun and offer sacrifices to village deities.

Sarnaism is the folk religion of the Kurukh and Munda peoples of the Chota Nagpur plateau in eastern India. Claiming to be an ancient belief system existing since time immemorial, Sarnaism, known locally as Sarna Dhorom and to outsiders as the Religion of the Holy Woods, is a nature worshipping faith largely detached from surrounding Hindu and Abrahamic religions. Sarnaists reject the Varna system and foreign religious texts, instead following a codified set of deities and rituals. The supreme deity of the Sarna religion is the Sun god Dharmes, who is believed to be the force of unquestionable good in the world, hampered only by human vices. Sarnaists believe that the old world was struck down by Dharmes as punishment for mankind's destruction of nature, and consider it their main duty to preserve and protect nature from those who wish to exploit and destroy it. Once a year Sarnaists observe the Sarhul festival, a three day period of celebration in which priests called Pahan offer sacrifices to the mother goddess Chala Pachchho and ancestral spirits, celebrating marriage between the Earth and the Sun.

The Baha'i religion preaches in favor of the establishment of world peace, equality, and emphasises the unity of all people and religions. The faith derives from the teachings of Baha'u'llah, a pre-event Persian, though following the Event much information on his life has been lost.

Born in antiquity, Baptism is a strain of Protestantism that is highly charismatic and vigorous. It believes that only adult believers should be baptised, and that too by full bodily immersion in water. They reject most of the Catholic sacraments and follow a Congregational model of Church governance. Baptists after the Event became isolated from their homeland in America, and mostly exist as religious minorities in India and Turkestan due to prior missionaries evangelizing heavily in those regions. In northeastern India, they became a majority and established the first Baptist kingdom in the Old World. In a small portion of Turkestan, a notable number of Uyghur converts from long ago desperately attempt to survive by all means necessary.

The Bezpopovtsy faith is the descendant of various schisms of the Old Believer faith. After the Event, those various schism formed a loose organization of temples that pray without priests. Tending to be extremely insular, the Bezpopovtsy faith is rare to see outside of small villages.

A faith originating in the wake of the event in the previously extremely atheistic nation of Czechia, Osvicenism is a fusion of both Christian and Buddhist beliefs which had grown significantly in popularity within the nation. Founded by a Czech Buddhist Monk who had been raised a Catholic, he found a way to unite his disparate beliefs together under one system which appealed to the people across Czechia and Goralia. Later this system of belief would spread east by several Monks to the Buddhists of Kalmykia, converting many and becoming a stronghold of the faith. It espouses that while it was to the Buddha that God revealed how one may ascend to heaven, it was only available to the most ascetic of monks, it was only through the sacrifice of Christ that this pathway was made open to all. It views sins such as Pride or Lust as faults which must be overcome by meditation on their meaning and the emotional state which they cause. Only by conquering these faults across multiple lifespans may a person purify themselves and therefore escape the cycle of Birth, Death, Purgatory and Rebirth which all but the most ascetic monks are trapped within. Those ascetics are close to fulfilling their escape to heaven where they will join God as saints.

The Sea Creed faith is more a loose group of superstitions from the Atlantic and the Mediterranean. The corsairs of those seas hold together their crews through the fear inspired by the risks of going against the Code of the Sea, and of course against their ruler. Most rulers turn a blind eye on the acts and rituals of the Sea Creed, especially because the Corsairs bring in a fair profit.

Born before the Event on the mountains of Switzerland, some say from a great sage born in the depth of the Alps, the Calvinist faith has greatly grown after the Event. Under rulers chosen by heaven itself (for no ruler that is not chosen could ever be King of the Calvinists for long) the Calvinist faith is prepared to fight to expand the true Christian way.

Surviving through the Event, like it did through so many other crises great and small, the Catholic faith however did not come out unscathed. Once the faith of almost all of Europe, now Catholicism survives divided, surrounded by new faiths, some claiming to be the true Christian faith and some swearing to destroy it. The remaining Catholics have to hold together, or be destroyed.

A ancient faith first revived on the Aran islands of Ireland, spreading to the nearby Galway, Mayo and Sligo. While not a direct successor, it has survived somewhat in the background of Ireland's long Christianization. It worships the spirits which inhabit all places in the world, having returned from the otherworld where they were banished by the Christian Saint Patrick. The event destroyed the barriers he put in place allowing the spirits to return once again. Of particular worship are water spirits as they give life. The ruler of these fae is Lir, Old King of the Sea, and his Swan children. The rulers of this faith are also Draoithe themselves and as such are permitted to directly hold temples.

Genevism is a Calvinist movement founded, according to legend, early after the Event during the reign of Emperor Jürgen the Holy. The Genevese are named after the Council of Geneva, which all Calvinist priests in Europe attended. The Council announced the proclamation of the Calvinist Theocracy as the official form of governance of the entire Alpenreich, which caused a number of priests to storm out, leading to their excommunication and the subsequent founding of the Genevese Church. Following this schism, the Genevese Church eventually took more radical stances regarding Calvinist politics, advocating for total separation of the realm of God and the realms of men. According to the Genevese, all of God's laws cannot be realistically enforced on Earth, and as such Theocracy cannot be the ideal way to govern as it is fundamentally flawed. Though their popularity has waned in the years after the Council, relegating them to legend, Genevese thought may yet be revived once theocratic rule fails the Calvinist faithful.

This distinct sect of Judaism, practiced by the Betah Israeli Jews of Ethiopia has too survived the Event. Their Biblical texts have a few additions to the usual Jewish Bible. After the event, several old customs were revived, such as the unique monastic traditions that differ from the traditions of other Jews.

Zoroastrians worship Ahura Mazda, the uncreated God, as proclaimed by the ancient Iranian prophet Zoroaster. It was the official religion of all Persian empires (except the Hellenic Seleucid Empire) until the Muslim conquest of the Sassanid Empire in 651. The ancient form of the religion involved great sacred hill top fires and the exposure of dead bodies to scavenger birds for cleansing, while the modern form of this religion instead mainly focuses on the following of its primary creed, "Good Thoughts, Good Deeds, Good Words." As such, they are very generous and charitable despite the fact their religion has seriously declined in its number of adherents. The two largest surviving communities can be found in central Iran and Western India, though there was an attempt at revival in the Yarsani Kingdom of Kurdistan in recent history.

Based on a collection of texts uncovered by a Zoroastrian Priest in late 23rd century Tajikistan. This faith holds that the god of time Zorvan is father to both Ahura Mazda and Angra Mainyu and that Zorvan guides humans destiny through various celestial implements. One key difference between this sect and its ancient forebearer is that it contends that Humans must have free will otherwise the command by Ahura Mazda to do good is pointless, thus a divine being would not state such. The faith looks slightly more favourably on Angra Mainyu than traditional Zoroastrianism due to him being one of Zorvan's sons. Additionally they believe that Zorvan's sons must both exist for there to be a universal balance, they believe that there can be no good without evil and no order without chaos to compare it to, while Ahura Mazda is the sibling worthy of worship Angra Mainyu should be respected for the role he plays in the natural order of Zorvan's weave. Because of these beliefs it was driven from its Tajik homeland by its fellow Zoroastrians and the religion found popularity amongst the Sarikoli. The religion generally speaking is not aggressive and if not for it's aggressive neighbours would continue residing amongst its mountain tribes.

Dating back to the early days of Islam, the Qurani believe that Islamic law and guidance should only be based on the Koran, thus opposing any religious authority of the hadiths as well as caliphs. It is their belief that God's message in the Koran is clear and complete as is and that it can be fully understood without referencing outside scriptures. In the post Event era, the Qurani are heavily persecuted and often branded as apostates. They themselves view other Muslims as corrupted and seek to bring Islam back to its original form.

Navayana is a school of Buddhism founded in the decades leading up to the event. Its founder, Bhimrao Ambedkar was born a Hindu, but however following his study of the Buddha's teachings he became convinced of its truth. He found that all currently existing schools of Buddhism had become overly esoteric and no longer thought the Buddha's lessons as he would have wished them. As such he created the "Buddh aur unaka dhamm" which was a recounting of the Buddha's teachings and life with the addition of commentaries added by Ambedkar. This was meant to remove some of the esotericism which had developed in the previously existing sects.

A heresy spawned from just before the event from the theology of Father Matta El Meskeen. He came to blows with the Coptic papacy over the nature of original versus personal sin and the importance of personal faith in god over that of the collective faith in the church. He believed Original sin prior to Jesus was something that an individual could overcome through good deeds and that after the crucifixion one could overcome original sin by either accepting Jesus as their savior or through their own good deeds. As such Mattaists are extremely charitable to their impoverished citizens. He also believed in the total separation of the church and the state such that the church would not interfere with state policies. Overall the importance he placed on personal faith and his critiques of the Coptic church led to Mattaists believing post event that they no longer needed a papacy to govern them.

The Neo-Fraticelli, or 'New Little Brethren', is a Catholic heresy that was inspired by records of a medieval heresy of the same name. It is devoted to poverty and asceticism - especially for men of the cloth. Fraticelli heretics are violently opposed to Church wealth and displays of opulence among the populace. This is due to Mammon Prince of Greed being viewed as the demon King of the old world, he grew so powerful as to overthrow Lucifer Prince of Pride himself. He brought about the fall of the old world intentionally therefore the sin of greed is considered as fatal, if not more than, pride. They see the old world as a society of Pharisees who, instead of helping those in need, separated from them because they bothered their hearts.
Now that Egypt is finally in Coptic hands, we can use this momentous occasion to move the Papal seat back to its ancient home of Alexandria, ending the centuries long exile.

Mandaeism or Mandaeanism, also known as Sabaeanism , is a monotheistic and gnostic religion with a strongly dualistic cosmology. Its adherents, the Mandaeans, revere Adam, Abel, Seth, Enos, Noah, Shem, Aram, and especially John the Baptist. The name 'Mandaean' is said to come from the Aramaic manda meaning "knowledge". Within the Middle East, but outside of their community, the Mandaeans are more commonly known as the Subba or Sabians. The term Subba is derived from the Aramaic root related to baptism, the neo-Mandaic is Sabi. Occasionally, Mandaeans are called "Christians of Saint John".

Legends tell that during the reign of the Romans, Emperor Constantine was blessed by God to save his realm from the invading hordes of Goths and Turks. Many stories were told about this holy figure: some say that he united Europe under his rule after decades of division, others say that he sacrificed himself to save his people from the ravenous Turks. But one thing is certain, and that is on the day of his death, the Angels of the Lord turned him into a statue of marble and hid him under the depths of Constantinople. This is so that in the final days of the world, Constantine could awaken once more to lead the people of God onto salvation as their blessed and immortal emperor.

Neo-Huguenots believe that all rulers are in the service of God, and God only. Any ruler not deemed to serve God and the people are to be named tyrants, and overthrowing them is not only necessary, but a divine right. They believe that if every tyrant is removed from the face of the Earth, eternal prosperity will come to it, and so they try to go on grand campaigns to rid the world of these scum. Neo-Huguenots are heavily inspired by the Monarchomach theorists of pre-event France and consider tyrannicide to be a necessity in the fight for equality before God. They see feudalism as a tool for self-serving monarchs to consolidate more power for their selfish interests, so instead they follow a theocratic government where only the most pious and altruistic get to rule. The Queen of the Thelemites is considered to be the embodiment of a tyrant and her followers demon worshippers, and Novelists are known to have first brought back feudal law after the event, and so both are the main targets of Neo-Huguenot incursions. Catholics and other Protestants are both viewed with heavy distrust, as they both adhere to feudal structures and are also blamed for the destruction of the original Huguenots, a bitterness that never faded.

Neo-Donatists believe that the Last Judgement has come and the people of the world have been found lapse and unworthy of ascension. This means that all people on earth are stained by their sins and have been abandoned by God. The theology of this heresy ponders the implications of the event that destroyed the world of men identifying It, as many Christians did, with the Last Judgement. But in particular, adherents of this branch of Orthodoxy asked themselves if the apocalypse came to the world, why haven't the dead been resurrected and the rightful called at the right of the Father. There are different interpretations of why this happened: some believe that during the Event the apocalypse happened in full, the dead were revived and the children of God judged. What remains of the world today is nothing but the tortures of hell. Others believe that the Event has only heralded the apocalypse and the only reason why the dead haven't been resurrected is that the earth was so full of sin that God rebuked it. Thus, the world now exists as a limbo between the Judgement of God and the damnation of Hell.

A post event religion from across the Atlantic and near the Great Lakes, the Four Guardians faith has a deep connection to the cycles of the world and its natural power. Principally, there are only five truly divine beings in its cosmology, the Five Thunderbirds. The four lesser birds rule over each of the four winds and the greater Thunderbird, their father, rules over all creation. The four seasons of the year are ruled by four demi-gods - Paul Bunyan the Sower of Spring, Minne the Mistress of the Great River, Jack O'Lantern the Headless Bringer of Fall, and Father Christmas, who both rules over winter and delivers the Child, which is a representation of the new year being born following the battle between King Boreas and Vulcanus Rex.

A faith hailing from the far shores of Greenland. The inhabitants of those regions adopted most of the beliefs of the Inuits, syncretizing them with the Christian faith. They believe in the sea trinity of Arnakuagsak, Sassuma Arnaa and Nerrivik, the three rulers of the sea. Other gods include the unnamed Røde Sømand, the stone-faced Qooqa and the great Martin Jaegeren, while the evil gods include the wrothful Adlet, the ferocious Amarok and the vengeful Tupilaq. Its followers give great importance to the act of hunting and the respect of the spirits.

§Y*§! Kings and Emperors of this religion by default utilise parliaments.

Less a religion and more of a collection of philosophic ideas, Constitutionalism is the main doctrine by which the government of the United States operates under. Favoring a pragmatic mix of clemency and ruthlessness to achieve hegemony over the east coast of North America, Constitutionalists are applying their doctrine into their policies of governance to great effect.

Consisting of the remains of the Catholic Church in the United States, due to little to no contact with the Papacy in Rome, they resorted to self management under the newly formed Latin Patriarchate of Washington sponsored by the federal government. While the Latin Patriarch is no Pope, he is the highest Catholic religious authority on US soil.

A significant portion of American Protestants fall under Mainline Protestantism, rejecting Evangelicalism or Charismaticism, they stay true to the decentralist ideals of Protestantism and thus, have no religious authority.

The Levant has long been home to several Christian denominations,such as the Assyrian Church, Chaldean Catholics, and Oriental Orthodox. These churches had few or no theological differences, and were mostly distinguished by which Rite they used to celebrate the Liturgy. However, after the Event, these differences no longer seemed as significant as the need for cohesion and survival in the face of societal collapse, and so the Syriac Orthodox and Chaldean Catholic Churches joined together. This 'new' old Church is led by the Patriarch of Antioch and All the East.

With enough power and control of sufficient holy sites, a Stalinist ruler could declare themselves High Chairman - the supreme spiritual ruler to whom religious and political obedience is owed by all.

It has been many years since any single ruler held enough power to be considered the true Tsar of all the Russias. If we are able to unite the ancestral heartlands of Russia, we may be able to finally revive that august institution in truth.

Where Nobelians believe in the use of Knowledge for peace, Dynamiters consider it a mean to bring glory in battle. This fringe movement claims that war is the greatest of all arts of man, and endeavors to rebuild the great weapons of destruction that made humanity invincible. Following teachings that are believed to come from the great master of war they call the Merchant of Death, they will endeavor to bring back the glory of humanity's power of science, dedicating it to the art of war and destruction.

The Kalevalalaulu faith is an offshoot of ancient Finnish paganism which experienced a resurgence in the lands of Finland and Karelia in the years since the Event. Fusing traditional belief of the Sami, Finnish and Karelian people, the Kalevalalaulu faith is endemic to the region, and focuses more on protecting Finland, Karelia and the lands of the Sami, rather than expanding outwards. Yet, so far no conqueror has ever managed to take those northern lands, and all believers share the faith that it is thanks to the teachings of Ukko and Ilmatar and the bravery of their followers.

Now united, the faith is better prepared to defend the homeland and people to Väinämöinen against the Devilmen, the Crown worshippers, the Cross, and any other faith that may come to face them.

A belief system with roots stretching back to the popular culture of the old Russia and Soyuz, Folklorism contains in itself a diverse and sometimes contradictory mythology, mainly centered around Rodina, Patron Goddess of Russians, under whose guidance they conquered everything from Brandenburg to the far reaches of Siberia, her Allies and Enemies and a lot of Lesser Deities such as Prince Nevsky, Visotsky the Bard or Ataman Kudeyar, who are believed to possess magnificent powers which they sometimes grant to mortal followers in exchange for worship.

A religion whose roots stretch back to the popular culture of the old Russia and Soyuz, Folklorism is build and structured upon the pantheon of deities, which is centered around Rodina, Patron Goddess of Russians, under whose guidance they conquered everything from Brandenburg to the far reaches of Siberia. Restructured and cleaned up from unneeded priestly squabble, Folklorism is prepared to withstand the pressure of Tsarsists and Crossmen.

Gelugpa, or 'Yellow Hat' Buddhism is one of the traditional schools of Tibetan Buddhism and has absorbed many of the other schools in Tibet since the Event. It originated from Mahayana Buddhism,and retains many of its traditions,including an emphasis on Bodhisattvas and their intervention in the lives of believers. Traditionally,the Gelugpa are led by the Dalai Lama, but long ago the Panchem Lama was captured by the Chinese, preventing him from recognising the reincarnation of the next Dalai Lama. As a result, the traditional means of selecting the Dalai Lama was abandoned, and he is now elected by a council of Lamas from around Tibet.

The followers of the Jacobinist faith believe that Robespierre, savior of humanity, came to the world to placate the eternal hunger of Madame Guillotine. After the death of her prophet, killed by the ignorance of traitors, Madame Guillotine was left unfed, and in the end it was humanity that paid the price in the form of the Event, when she took all the lives she was denied for too long. The Jacobinists have sworn that this will never again happen. Madame Guillotine shall never again be left without food, no matter the cost. It is a sacrifice of a few for the sake of the many.

The youngest of all Syncretic churches, the Jugoslavist faith was born when the Car of Jugoslavia, hard pressed in keeping his diverse Empire united, made a desperate attempt, calling a great Council of all holy men in his lands, fusing all faiths in his domains in a single religion and forcing them all to accept it or lose their heads. Taking from both the beliefs of Orthodox and Catholics, and additionally from the teachings of the Sunni Prophet, Jugoslavism is still weak, not truly spread outside of the capitals of the nation, where the Kings have more or less begrudgingly embraced the edict of the Emperor. The only one that can strengthen it is the Car of all Jugoslavia.

The Karmapa or 'Red Hat' school of Buddhism was once simply another form of Tibetan Buddhism, considered equally valid alongside the others. However, when the Chinese captured the Panchem Lama, they produced a new Panchem Lama, a Han Chinese man whom they claimed to be the true Lama (called 'the Red Lama' by Tibetans). Most Tibetans rejected this 'new Lama', but some accepted him. This led to a rift in the community, as it was no longer clear who the real Panchem Lama was, thus the traditional means of selecting the Dalai Lama could no longer be used. Those who followed the Red Llama came to be confused with the historical 'Red Hats' school, and now even the knowledge that there used to be another group called by this name has been forgotten.

Katerinists hold that, though all of the Tsars are divine, the greatest of them is in fact Katerin, the Great Tsarina. They argue that she is obviously an incarnation of the goddess Mother Russia, whom they regard as the Great Spirit who empowers all Tsars. Mainstream Zarists, however, regard Mother Russia as a metaphor for Russia itself, and anathematize any who believe that she is a literal goddess. As a result of this, Katerinism is a persecuted heresy, though it remains popular among many women, especially the wives of rulers.

A blend of Mongol nationalism and Tengri paganism, Khanism is the belief in the divinity of the great legendary hero Temujin, who in times past conquered the world and gained the title of 'Genghis Khan', or 'Universal Ruler'. Khanists believe that, at the height of his power, Temujin was betrayed by his friend, Han, and cast into the jaws of The Red Menace. Now, they ride ever onward over the plains, hoping to find the Red Menace's cave and free Temujin from his imprisonment.

Descendants of the antediluvian religious orders of Lutheranism, their organization and military history carried them through the times of turbulence and back into prominence. Requiring strict discipline of their followers and of the priests they recreated their bishoprics across the major kingdoms, which in turn flowed into the militaries and economies of the enterprising rulers. At the core of it all was the reconquest and reformation of the Archbishopric of Lund, who, while hotly contested by rival kings for control of them, seek to reassert their power of the faith as a whole.

An amalgam of faiths centered on interpretations of longstanding tales and stories common across the regions it's practiced. Extremely decentralized with each village offering new interpretations of religious text and figures and with holy figures being anything from a village elder to a more traditional priest. All that holds them together is a mutual adherence to a reverence of saints like Martin Luther, Gustav the Lion, and others.

The Einblicker, or the Insightful, are a radical strain of Vagarna who split off long ago. They adhere strongly to the story of Satanael, an angel who fell in defiance of the corrupt whims of Yaldabaoth, a demonic power who fooled humanity into thinking it was God. Satanael allied itself with the hero Luther who sought out warriors and true believers to topple the pope and his false god. In honour of this story they have moved ever further south, where they are now in majority, ready to pounce on the papist realms before them.

With obscure origins dating back to antediluvian missionaries from Western Europe, Eastern Protestantism is an amalgamation of various Protestant sects with Orthodoxy. Its congregation exists as a loose union of churches formed from the remnants of these ancient missionary activities. Despite the influences, Eastern Protestantism still maintains Orthodox traditions since its inception, and are preformed in the Byzantine Rite. Its adherents also share many commonalities Syriac and Chaldean Churches, which include religious calendars, festivals, and reverence of saints. At the same time, Eastern Protestants also revere Western Protestant figures like Lucas Cranach the Elder, Martin Luther, John Calvin, and Roger Williams.

The Ma'aravim, or the "Westerners" are an amalgam of Jewish sects in America, consisting of Reform, Masorati and Orthodox Jews. The Ma'aravim have long since integrated into the American system and thus are far removed from the affairs of old world Judaism. The Ma'aravim believe that the only way for the Messiah to eventually come is through 'repairing the world' through Tikkun Olam, a guideline to be righteous, kind and pious.

Originally hailing from eastern Europe, the Hasidic movement has found itself most prevalent in the United States. Initially part of the greater American Jewish community, in time, the Hasidic movement had effectively split from the rest of Ma'aravi Judaism and largely bases itself in more rural Jewish communities across the United States. While they agree about core principles of Hasidic Judaism, many sects have arose following the teachings of several important Rebbes.

The Malikite school of thought was originally simply one of many schools of jurisprudence within Sunni Islam, and in most parts of the world that is still the case. However, in Post-Event Morocco, the term has come to signify the teachings of a group that, though they still call themselves Sunni Muslims of the Maliki school, have developed some heterodox beliefs, especially as regards who can be Caliph. In the chaos of the Post-Event world, many Muslims yearn for a Caliph to unite and defend the Ummah, but nobody has been strong enough and legitimate enough to do so in several hundred years. The Malikites of Morocco, seeing the power of the Alaouite dynasty, came to believe that an Alaouite could become Caliph, even if he were not of the Quraysh tribe. This position has brought them into conflict with other Muslims, creating a rift in African Islam.

The Maronite Catholic Church is an Eastern Catholic church that has been in full communion with Rome for centuries. Though they use a different Rite to celebrate the Liturgy than Latin Catholics,they have no substantial theological differences,and thus enjoy good relations with each other. The Maronite Church exists primarily in Lebanon,and is led by the Patriarch of the Levant.

Founded by the great Prophet Mubarak, a great scholar and adventurer that found the truth on the history of the great Judges, Mesopotamianism is internally considered an Islamic faith, but is regarded as heretical and largely rejected by mainstream Muslims. They still consider themselves Muslims, but also honour the Ancient Djinns traditional to Mesopotamia, such as 'Ishtar' or 'Ea', whom they believe are Archangels loyal to Allah. They hold that under the ancient Empire of Mesopotamia they ruled all the east as one great domain of God, yet they were ultimately shattered apart by the machinations of Shaytan, and his wife, the Queen, who led an Immortal Empire of Chaos against them. They believe that it is their destiny to reunify the Islamic world and call upon a final battle with the Empire and usher in a new golden age.

First spread to India by Saint Thomas the Apostle over 25 centuries ago, the Nasrani sect of Christianity has always been a minority in India. With the chaos of the Event cutting India off from most outside communication, the various Nasrani Churches (both those in communion with the Pope and those in communion with the Eastern Church) united together for the sake of convenience. The example of several holy men has caused the Nasranis to grow in popularity over the last few decades, to the point where they are a majority in Kerala, in the southwestern coast of India, though they are still a minority overall.

More similar to followers a philosophical belief than a religion, Nobelians believe that Knowledge is what drove the people before the Event to greatness. Among those men, the greatest in all the fields of Knowledge were Nobel and his laureates, whose discoveries led humanity forward. However, the Merchant of Death always whispers in the hears of those willing to listen, and so it was that the glory of humanity also created great destruction, until the world was returned to the darkness of ignorance. The Nobelians struggle to return humanity to its former glory, believing they can recreate the greatness of the old world.

Originating in the distant and unknowable snowlands east of Russia, Razumism is a religion focused on the belief in a phenomenon known as "Mirovoy Razum" by which all human consciousness is thought to be linked. Razumists believe that this world mind is capable of altering human consciousness and the world. This is the origin of spirits with some being the human perspective of concepts and others being the impact humans have left on the collective mind after their death, enabling them to somewhat live on post death. They believe that the Event was caused by the uncontrolled collective mind growing restless and harming humanity. They believe that if humanity is to return to a pre-event stage of advancement it must first mature collectively.

Razumist is a religion from far Siberia, focused on something referred to as 'Mirovoy Razum', a entity connecting all of humanity. It is believed that this entity is capable of influencing both human consciousness and the world. This is the origin of spirits with some being the human perspective of concepts and others being the impact humans have left on the collective mind after their death, enabling them to somewhat live on post death. The religion has been reformed and codified, with a unified set of beliefs and rituals.

Romuva is polytheistic, with a pantheon of gods led by Dievs, god of the sky. Other main gods include Perkunas, god of thunder and lightning, very similar to the ancient Scandinavian god Thor and the Slavic Perun. Other important deities include Saule, goddess of the sun and fertility, Daugava and Meness. After the Apocalypse this ancient religion underwent a renaissance in its number of followers until the majority of the Lithuania, Latvia and Western Belarus were followers of the faith. The Catholics of Nearby Poland could not stand for the heathenry which their once Lithuanian brothers had adopted and they led the charge in a crusade to wipe out the faith in Lithuania once more. By 2555 the religion exists only in a few isolated pockets, largely in secret given the Catholic faith which has reclaimed Lithuania.

The church also has a standardized liturgy and a formal church hierarchy it has undergone an even greater renaissance than its first re-emergence.

Originating in France, the Novelist faith believes that the truth of the origin of the world and all life is not contained in a single book, but is fragmented among the many books that humanity produced. Novelists believe The Novel, the magnum opus penned by Eru l'Auteur and the Valar at the beginning of time, is divided into various ages and revealed, reveals and will reveal itself to the faithful across time. The Novelists believe in a cyclical nature of the world in which the nations of men take different names. They see all other nations to be still clinging to the name of the previous Age, and endeavour to correct this mistake while collecting all works of literature, in hopes they will reveal more of the Novel's content. Additionally, they believe in many figures from these fragments of the Great Novel as being worthy of worship for the role they partook, the worship of these figures varies depending on their importance to the Novel.

Originating from a pre-Event split within the Russian Orthodox Church, the reasons for the Old Believers' existence is lost in the mists of time. They maintain that the Russian Church, under the influence of the demon Nikon, tried to pervert and destroy Christ's Church, creating the Zarist faith. However, their ancestors escaped into the wild, where they hid until eventually the wrath of God destroyed the apostate Russia, no longer deserving the title of 'Holy'. In-game, the Old Believers are extremely resilient to outside influences both military and proselytic.

Split from the Catholic church in days lost in the mist of time, the Orthodox Church grew to a great extent before the event, stretching from Greece to Russia. After the Event, however, much like the other Christian faiths, much ground was lost to new faiths as people turned to forgotten gods and new deities. However, thanks to the Transnistrian Empire, not all hope is lost for the faith that once held together many great Empires.

The main branch of the Jewish faith, the Orthodox kept the ancient traditions alive in the changing world before the Event. And once the Event fell upon humanity, more and more Jews joined the Orthodox school, which became the main branch of Judaism once again. Most Jews today are part of the Orthodox faith, and any other is considered an heretic.

Split away from the main Orthodox church in the deep mists of time over the true nature of Christ, the Hay Arak'elakans take the Miaphysite stance as was proclaimed by Saint Cyril of Alexandria, which stated that Christ had a nature which was equally divine and mortal. In the time since the Event, the Church has greatly assisted its Kingdom in holding back the Yarsani tide to the south.

In the final days before the event, the Archangel Raphael sent a vision to a man now known as a great Saint to the Sevillians. It showed him that Rome had become corrupt once more and that the Vicar of Christ should no longer be seated in that wretched city, instead demanding it should be seated in the righteous city of Seville, and if this did not occur a great calamity would befall the world. He attempted to warn the church of the vision, who refused to place their faith in him. In preparation for the oncoming calamity he sought to gather as many followers as possible and establish a new church in the world which would come after, becoming the first Sevillian Pope. When he revealed to the people of Spain that it was the Papacy who had led them to the apocalypse, many of the most fundamentalist Catholics who in the years before the event had grown tired with the growing progressivism of the church flocked to this new church's banners after the event, believing it to better represent the church of old. With all of Spain now following the Sevillian Pope, the faith can now hope to crush the misguided Catholics and their Pope in Rome, and return the world under the shield of the one true church.

Unlike mainstream Zarism, Petrism is a strictly monotheistic faith. It holds that there was and is in fact only one Tsar, the immortal Peter the Great. All other Tsars are impostors, seeking to steal from him his rightful worship. They are thus regarded as the worst kind of heretics by mainstream Zarists due to their outward hostility towards the other cults. In-game, Petrists benefit from increased martial and learning stats, as the Petrist Cult teaches that one should strive to emulate Peter in his advances in the fields of science and military strategy.

A sect of Lutheranism which believes that the past aggressive nature and hubris of the German people was the cause of the event, dooming all of antediluvian civilisation. As such they are pacifists, believing that only once a ruler has become the Kanzler of oneself may they become the Kanzler of all Germans. Despite being pacifists they will still enact holy violence to bring justice against the wicked.

While Meshicist Judaism in Israel widely accepted the Israeli Monarchy's claim for the title of Messiah ben David, a group of Jewish scholars disagreed with the claim and said that the several descriptions of the Messiah found across Jewish theological texts across the ages conflict with the events that unfolded in Jerusalem. The Mikraists instead believe that the primacy of the older generations of Rabbis cannot be challenged by the current generation of thinkers and thus no contradictions are allowed to arise. The Mikraists seek to find the legendary Mashiach ben Yosef, who they believe is hidden among pious Jews, awaiting to be found and lead the Jewish people to the Messianic Age by cleansing the Land of Israel from evil forces and rebuild a proper Third Temple.

Once a prominent school of thought in Judaism, the Reform faith has since the Event fallen out of favour in most Jewish communities. Today, only a handful of people still preach the idea that the Reform faith is the one true school of Judaism.

Originating in the teachings of Guru Nanak, a pre-Event preacher and holy man, Sikhism is a religion distinct from both Islam and Hinduism. It rejects the caste system and believes that all people can come to true knowledge of God. Though technically monotheistic, its theology is markedly different from that of the Abrahamic religions, and could easily be described as Monistic or Panentheistic. In-game, Sikhs receive stronger armies due to their commitment to armed defence of their religion against larger, more aggressive religions.

Leninists are a sect of Stalinists who believe that while the usurpation of Nicholas the Bloody was a just one, it was the great leader Lenin who led a great revolt ordained by the Great Holy Spirit to overthrow the tyrant Tsar who had betrayed the wishes of the Great Holy Spirit. After the defeat of the Tsar at the hands of the revolution, Lenin sought to return his body and divine essence to the Great Holy Spirit only for him to be struck down by Stalin and Trotsky, who wished to steal the Tsar's power for themselves. Stalin kept Trotsky at bay long enough to steal the Tsar's power all for himself, ascending to godhood. The Holy Spirit was enraged at this turn of events and told Stalin that one day, Lenin would reincarnate among the Russian people to destroy him and his followers. Only then under the rule of the Leninov would Russia become a land of peace and prosperity once again.

The Stalinist faith reveres Lord Stalin as the only Tsar worthy of worship as he earned his divinity through his own deeds. Mainstream Zarism came to regard Stalin-worship as heretical early on due to legends that portray Tsar Stalin as having usurped his power from Nicholas the Martyr by killing him with the help of Lenin and Trotsky and consuming his essence, as such the Stalinists were driven away by long years of persecution. Stalinists believe that only through tireless devotion and loyalty can they help Lord Stalin defend the Motherland from its many enemies including the Great Holy Spirit who wishes to bring ruin to all Stalinist realms for Lord Stalin's usurpation. They also believe that similar to their lord they may become divine like a Tsar by consuming the essence of one. Stalin is believed to have been betrayed following his ascension by one of his followers, this traitor attempted to consume Stalin as Stalin had consumed Nicholas. He survived this assault on his being, but was so distraught by it that he saw traitors everywhere and used his divine powers to purge them. It is still debated to this day who this traitor was exactly.

Properly speaking, Sufism is a tradition of mystical thought common to all kinds of Islam, but only in Central Africa have such schools come to dominate the religious landscape. Focusing on the inward, mystical dimension of Islam, the isolation of the post-Event world has caused African Sufis to develop unique characteristics that distinguish them from more mainstream Islam. Some sects have adopted beliefs from native African paganism, while others are more conservative and stick closer to Sunni orthodoxy. Yet others draw inspiration from the Salafist and Wahhabi movements in West Africa, attempting to 'purify' Islam from foreign influence.

Followers of the Summer Queen believe that long ago in Avalon the Queen married a mighty and noble Knight. The Queen was given dominion over the Summer, and the knight became the King of Winter. Celebrations usually include morris dancing, maypoles, wicker men, and vast amounts of cider. The Summer Queen grants health and prosperity to her followers while the Winter King protects the people from invaders and evil faery with his magical sword Excalibur.

Theosophists are the followers of the Ascended Masters, beings that shepherd the spiritual and intellectual development of humanity. Theosophy was merely one of many foreign esoteric religions to gain a foothold in the British Isles following the Event and the subsequent collapse of the Church. Nonetheless, it was eventually largely stomped out by Thelemites and their Queen. According to Theosophist teachings, it was when the world closed their hearts to the lessons of the Ascended Masters that mankind grew distant from Nature and Truth relying more and more upon false religions before the Old World collapsed under the burden of ignorance and desire that it carried upon its back. Numerous legends hold that a Lord Maitreya will emerge to transfer knowledge about the true constitution and workings of Existence to humankind. Theosophists de-emphasise the importance of organized religious scripture, ritual, and hierarchy as a source of direct enlightenment, viewing them simply as roads for every individual to access the source of Truth. Additionally, Theosophy in the British Isles holds large amounts of influence from the Thelema faith, viewing the Queen as an ascended master in her own right.

This character is channeling Saint Germain, the chohan of the seventh ray, the Hierarch of the Age of Aquarius, portrayed as a diplomat, the embodiment of dignity and statesmanship. Saint Germain is considered responsible for the founding of many civilisations and movements throughout history, including his incarnations as the god-king of the Golden Empire in the Sahara desert, the High Priest of Atlantis, the prophet Samuel, Saint Joseph, the explorer Columbus, and the philosopher Bacon. Following the Event with the heralding of the Aquarian Age his role as the Lord of Civilisation meant he became the main divine force alongside Sanat Kumara responsible for the rebuilding of civilisation and the retrieval of the God flame back into humanity's grasp.

This character is channeling Sanat Kumara, a powerful cosmic being, the Guru of Christ, hierarch of Venus and one of the seven holy Kumaras, said to be the former Lord of the World and the founder of the Great White Brotherhood, the fraternity of Ascended Masters across the world. Theosophists believe that following the Event he stepped down as the Lord with Saint Germain, the Lord of Civilisation taking his place, tasked with bringing the God flame back to humanity, and instead is dedicated to setting his believers on the path of the ruby ray from his domain in the mythical city of Shamballa.

This character is channeling Lady Master Venus, said to be the Divine Complement and Twin Flame to Sanat Kumara. Mankind is said to be her evolution, and she herself came to Earth following the Event to bring the holy flames of civilisation back to humanity. Some Theosophists also consider her to be a goddess of love.

This character is channeling Jesus Christ, the avatar of the Age of Pisces, the Messiah and the incarnation of the Word. During the Piscean age, he revealed the Christ Self to humanity to show the works of the God presence to each human soul. Theosophists believe that following his resurrection, Jesus travelled to Kashmir, where he ascended to the theric city of Shamballa. Following the Event, the Christ consciousness had been lost to many, leading to people turning away from his teachings en masse. Veneration of Jesus is seen with suspicion by the Thelemites, who consider him to be nothing more than an arrogant mystic.

This character is channeling Our Lady of the Stars, the highest Thelemite deity, considered a Master of Ancient Wisdom in Theosophist belief. Following the Event, the Queen ascended to become a Hierarch of the Age of Aquarius, called the Aeon of Ma'at in Thelema, ruling the cosmos while Saint Germain rules the earthly domain. While Thelema belief states that the Queen is an unknowable supreme being, Theosophists believe they can channel her and even contact her telepathically.
As a theosophite i can channel a ascended master to guide my growth.

The Old Thelema faith, abandoned centuries ago by most inhabitants of the British Empire in favour of the current Thelema faith. Old Thelema focused more on the personal will of the individual, and for this was considered the ultimate cause of the Civil War in the 23rd century. Since then, only pockets of Old Thelemites have survived, while the new faith, Summer Queen and the Orange King hold the country. However, some Lodges still survive, hidden deep in the countryside of Britain.

The Thelema faith was founded by the great prophet Aleister Crowley long before the Event. However, only after it the faith truly became widely accepted and reformed. The Queen rules over the nation and this cosmos, she ensures as ruler of the heavens ensures the eternal dominion of Brittannia over the Waves. As she is beyond this world, the ruler of the British is the Lord Protector, a man or woman that guards the throne until the Queen decides to return to the mortal plane once again.

Being the largest remaining Jewish community in Europe and the de-facto leaders of the continent's Jewry has made the United Synagogue of Britain one of the most influential institutions in Old World Judaism. Just like Britain of old, the Empire of Britannia has decided to continue recognizing the United Synagogue as an authority in Judaism and has promoted it as an umbrella organization for the myriad Jewish sects dotting Britain. Since then, the United Synagogue has integrated Sephardic congregations and has promoted a more secular lifestyle while keeping with orthodox Jewish traditions.

Appealing to the Yiddish speaking masses in the lower classes of British society during the last centuries before the Event, the Federation of Synagogues is a rival institution to the United Synagogue. While the United Synagogue has became more anglified and tends to fund grandiose projects such as cathedral synagogues, the Federationists prefer more communal and intimate congregations.

The oldest surviving school of Buddhism, Theravada originates from Sri Lanka, eventually spreading to many parts of Southeast Asia. It is the most conservative and orthodox school, basing itself on the Pali Canon. Its adherents focus on morally upright living and preserving the teachings of the Buddha as they were originally taught.

An obscure sect of Stalinism, Titoism holds that the follower who betrayed lord Stalin was the legendary ruler of Yugoslavia Tito. They believe that Tito betrayed Stalin in order to take the power he had stolen and utilise it to free his homeland from the rule of a despotic and malevolent Car. Titoists believe that Stalin did not survive the attempt on his life made by Tito and that Tito went on to free his homeland from the Tyranny of its old Car whom the great Holy spirit refused to strike down itself. Soon after he freed his people the Great holy spirit did battle with him in a great war for heaven, this was for having assisted in the murder of one of its appointed rulers and directly murdering another. This great heavenly war was the event and since that time Tito has been imprisoned in hell by the great holy spirit as he cannot be entirely destroyed given that he contains a fraction of the spirits own power. Only through devotion and loyalty from his small sect can Tito be freed and rule on earth once again.

A small offshoot of mainstream Stalinism, Trotskyists believe that Lord Stalin was in fact a traitor to Russia, and that Trotsky, an obscure figure in the Stalinist faith was his betrayer. He is believed to have betrayed Stalin because Stalin was abusing his divine powers, bringing ruin to Russia. Trotsky tried to reason with Stalin, that his power should be turned outward to the other rulers appointed by the Holy Spirit and that they should be overthrown. Stalin would not listen and it is additionally believed by the faith that Stalin was not originally meant to be the consumer of Nicholas when their group plotted his downfall. So Trotsky and others plotted the downfall of what they saw as another weak Tsar. Trotsky managed to consume part of Stalin in his attack, reducing Stalin's power significantly and conversely increasing the power of Trotsky. The two continued to battle continuously despite the damage done to the world, the peak of this being the event itself, yet until all Tsarists and Stalinists are destroyed and only Trotskyists remain, there can be no peace.

After a meeting with a representative of a Mexican Christian council, a fraction of Sevillians have decided that the Holy See was relocated again following the event, and is currently located in the far away lands of Mexico in a city on an island within a great lake, far beyond the Atlantic Ocean. Such revelation means that every single Christian Church of the Old World is a vile heresy! As such, Transatlantics declared themselves the representatives of the Pope in Mexico and his council of cardinals, and decided to take it upon themselves to spread the word of the One True Pope.

Cadaverists are a small heretic sect that believe that one of the last Antediluvian Popes is not in fact dead, but can still miraculously speak to members of the higher Cadaverist clergy. It is said that the angel Gabriel came to him during the event and froze his mind within his body to preserve it, as a way to protect him from the calamity. They believe he will some day be restored to his pre-event form once the Cadaverist faithful make up all of the Christian faithful. It is unknown how they came to that conclusion, or how they obtained a corpse in full Papal Regalia. Unsurprisingly enough, the mainstream Catholic Church is not happy about the fact they keep said corpse atop a golden recreation of the Holy See and insisting that it can communicate. Cadaverists meanwhile consider all post-event Church popes to be antipopes, and all other Christians vile heretics who abandoned the Pope, who obviously was blessed by God himself with immortality.

The Vajrayana school of Buddhism is one of the most important pre-Event Buddhist faiths to have survived after the Event. While not as dominant in the 26th century as Gelugpa, the Vajrayana followers still hold it to be the true school of Buddhism.

Salafism is a revivalist movement within Sunni Islam. Originating in Egypt in the shortly before the event, it came to be in defiance of the western world. Moving in step with smaller movements in Najd, Africa, Northern India, and more, just before the event it became a unified movement until the moniker of Salafiya. The name comes from the salaf, the first three generations of Muslims, which is believed to be the unadulterated and pure form of Islam. The Salafis believe that Sunnis should rely on the Quran and the Sunnah alone, while also rejecting any other branch or school of Islam as heretics or even non-Muslims.

Originating long before the Event, Zarism is a religion that holds that the world was created by a powerful spirit. Though he created all men, the majority of his children turned their backs on him and followed strange beliefs. Thus He abandoned them, and bestowed his favor only upon Holy Russia, his chosen people. Zarists hold that this Great Holy Spirit bestows his grace upon a temporal ruler, who is chosen to be Tsar. The Tsar is blessed by this Spirit, commands the full and unconditional obedience of the people, and upon death is taken up to Heaven and deified. Many Zarists express their piety through prayer to former Tsars and pilgrimages to their burial sites. Beneath the Tsars many of their servants are worshipped as minor holy men, though only on a regional level. Examples of these minor saints are Saint Benjamin in St.Petersburg or Saint Gennady in Novgorod, who both fought those who would challenge the will of the Great Holy Spirit and overthrow the Tsar.

An ancient religion, Jainism is believed by its followers to have always existed. The religion holds that by following the way of non-violence or 'ahimsa', humans can achieve liberation from the endless cycle of torment and reincarnation, as well as omnipotence, omniscience, and infinite bliss. Jainism used to be a widespread religion in India but dwindled greatly in the centuries before the Event, decreasing to a very small minority. That changed in the post-Event world, where a new order of monks, called the Neeraji, vigorously proselytise for the faith, resulting in a great resurgence of Jainism throughout India.

After the Event, the Hellenic faith has resurfaced. This new form of Hellenism believes that the event was caused by Alexander the Great being reborn as Anaxorgos and overthrowing his father, Zeus. He is the twin brother of Athena, following his rebirth from Zeus' body he convinced many of his younger relatives to rise against Zeus and overthrow him. Ares and Athena were quick to join Anaxorgos, having given him great favour in life as preparation for this battle. When Poseidon took to his brother's defence it was his son Triton, with the aid of his ship and trusty Nereid attendant Averof, who entered battle against the ancient god of the sea and imprisoned him. Persephone convinced Hades to not partake in this familial battle and so he was spared by Anaxorgos due to the aid rendered by Persephone and her Brother Philomelus. It was this great battle between the younger Olympians and those of the older generation which was the event, and said event is evidence of his cousins, siblings and his own destructive power. He now wishes to reclaim his old empire and expand it to encompass the world. The conquest was only halted by the formation of Yugoslavia, but for how long?

He is the twin brother of Athena, following his rebirth from Zeus' body he convinced many of his younger relatives to rise against Zeus and overthrow him. He now wishes to reclaim his old empire and expand it to encompass the world. Only the unification of all the Balkan countries in a single nation managed to stop them. Despite the hardship they had to endure, the Hellenists ultimately pulled together and fought back, uniting the faith and its people.

Thammayut is the most wayward school of Buddhism developed after the Event. It placed the emphasis on the goal of spreading the word of Buddha by violence and coercion over traditional pacifism. Strayed far from the original teaching of the Buddha, their monks were barred from a pilgrimage to the holy sites in the Subcontinent. Due to this sanction, it is only a matter of time before they marched west to correct this mistake.

What started as Protestantism spread by foreign missionaries long ago, Chinese Christianity later became something of its own. After the event, Christians in China became more isolated from mainstream Christendom. With that, it has adopted ideas from traditional Chinese philosophies and integrated them, forming a unique theology. For example, these Christians pray to their pious ancestors for guidance and believe that a 'Heavenly King' can maintain a Celestial Kingdom on Earth with a Mandate given by God.

There have always been those willing to fight and die for the Folklorist faith, but they have always been scattered and disunited. Now, with the reformation and organisation of the Folklorist faith, a warrior from Archangelsk has decided that these warriors should be gathered into a new order, an army dedicated purely to fighting the enemies of the faith.

For centuries, the Dharmic faith has been beset on all sides, and it has grown very adept indeed at defending itself against powerful external enemies. To this end, its holy warriors have developed a great tradition of hit-and-run fighting, being skilled in attacking enemies from the harsh jungle and retreating before retribution can arrive. Now, with the reorganisation of the Dharmic faith, the Warriors of Shiva have gathered together into a holy order - the Shiva's Executioners, dedicated purely to the defense of the Dharmic faithful against infidels.

The Jadidists first emerged in 19th century as a pro-westernization movement in Muslim regions of the Russian Empire. They argued for the pursuit of reason, implementation of the scientific method and liberalisation of society overall. After the Event though Jadidism became an "umbrella term" used to describe to preserve Muslim Turkic identity in the face of post-deluge chaos. As such it absorbed various Turkic folk beliefs such as reverence to the ancient spirits of Su Anasy and Su Babasy, Grandmother and Grandfather of all the Turkic folk. What little knowledge of pre-event world the Turkic people had preserved was also incorporated. The most venerated figure in Jadidism is Taraqqiy. It's generally accepted that this term represents a Knowledge God of some kind, but exact meaning of the term has been lost to history.

Across the great Atlantic, centuries before the Event, the mighty deities known as The Founders overthrew the rule of the British, founding the American Republic. Americanists are those who worship these great gods as the true lords of America, and indeed of the whole world. Though this faith originated across the seas, great America had rightful dominion over the entire world, and so they do not refuse the worship of foreigners, if only they will submit to the power of the Great Melting Pot.

Americanism is the faith of the Founding Fathers, those great Gods who threw the British into the Atlantic Ocean. This polytheistic faith has now been reformed, with a proper religious hierarchy established and more accurate and up-to-date holy texts brought over from across the Atlantic.
Magick is respected by the Mages and especially the High Sorcerer. It can be spent for various favours with the mages. Like Prestige, it is added to your score on the death of your ruler.

Oke-Tude is a syncretic faith that blends elements of Islam and Christianity together. Born among the Yoruba people of Nigeria, it has spread throughout the Nigerian Empire as a means of facilitating peace between Christians and Muslims, although many still resist it.

Liehuo follows the teachings of the Heavenly Ruby Chairman, ruler of the Heavenly Mandate of all. Though once a man, the Chairman ascended to godhood to protect China from the Eight Armies of Evil and the Event to restore harmony to the world after the Jade Emperor was deposed. He fought alongside one of the Jade Emperor's most powerful warriors, The Sapphire Didact, against these eight armies. Following their victory these two turned on each other for the throne of heaven and the followers of the Sapphire Didact were banished to Taipei, he still insidiously plots from his island realm among his followers. The Chairman's teachings are left behind in the Red Book for them to follow, so that they might achieve righteousness and not fall to the lies of either the old Jade Emperor or the Deceiving Sapphire Didact. They strongly believe in the obligation to spread the Ruby Chairman's influence to the rest of the world especially the holdouts of the Jade Emperor and Sapphire Didact.

Though having roots in the Old World, the Evangelical faith is now mostly an American faith. Derived from antediluvian Protestantism, it believes in the doctrine of salvation by grace alone and focuses on the centrality of the conversion experience to Christian life (traditionally known as 'being born again'). In its long isolation across the sea, heavy repression by the American government has left it more decentralized than ever though they remain strong in their faith nevertheless.

Though they claim to be Christians, the Batenburgers possess beliefs that mark them as being well outside the traditional Christian mainstream, believing in their unrestricted right to not only take violent vengeance upon unbelievers, but also to plunder and pillage them by force. Their highly combative nature makes them adept at war, but earns them the ire of their neighbours.

The Episcopal Church in Nigeria, also called the Church of Nigeria, quickly lost contact with their British counterparts during the Event. The Primate of Lagos declared all adherents to wait for further information from the Crown. However, as time went, rumors began to spread that the famed Queen Elizabeth II had passed, and that the Church itself in England was no more. Unwilling to accept such outlandish news, the Primate of Lagos declared himself as the head of the faith until contact with the Crown could be made again. After the fall of the Enwezor dynasty, Episcopalians refused to accept the new Yoruba led Oke-Tude faith and remained steadfast against conversion. For the faithful outside of Nigeria, the Primate can designate pious and powerful rulers as Protectors of the Faith, who serves as the de facto religious head.

The darkest and most alien of all the religions to come out of the West, Occultism regards its gods not as objects of worship, but only of propitiation. They believe that the universe is chaotic and beyond man's comprehension, and that contact with the Gods is sure to drive men mad. Instead, man ought to remain ignorant and comfortable, hidden from the notice of the divine, offering sacrifice only when necessary to lull them back to sleep - though some dangerous men and women dare to flirt with them for esoteric power.

The darkest and most alien of the religions to come out of the West, Occultism regards its gods not as objects of worship, but only of propitiation. The universe is too vast and chaotic for Man to fathom, and only in ignorance lies his safety from madness and the laughter of thirsting gods. To that end, the Occultist religion has been reformed, with a formalised hierarchy taking on the awful burden of learning more about the gods to properly propitiate them and keep them asleep, so that the rest of us may rest more easily at night.

Originating out of the predominantly Catholic Quebec, the Sedevacantists reject the authority of the American sponsored Latin Patriarch of Washington and have since then essentially lacked a central spiritual leader. A substantial portion of the Sedevacantists of Quebec have decided to set sail to the Old World to find the true Pope in Rome.
The Lotus-Robed is the Gelugpa Abbot considered most likely to succeed the Dalai Lama.
The Catholicos Expectant is the Apostolic Archbishop considered most likely to succeed the Catholicos.

Originating in the plains of Kazakhstan, the Temirizm faith believes that in ancient times the Creator granted humanity the Gift of Metal, but Mankind abused it, damaging the world and draining the sacred Aral Sea, eventually attracting the ire of the Creator and causing the Event. Now, Temirizm followers seek the forgiveness of the Steel Godhead by religiously thanking it every time they use metal, be it for minor actions, for war or for the construction of their famed war chariots. The Temirizm faith religiously protects the surviving Aral Lakes, in hopes of one day restoring them to the glory of the Sacred Sea. The Faith also revers a number of other spiritual beings, that are said to represent the might and glory of mankind and the Creator. Among those are the Siblings Spirits of War Kalashnikov, Katyusha and Gvozdika, the Spirit of Fertility and Nature Tselina, and the Spirit that guards workers, Udarnik. Other Spirits are considered a menace, such as the Destroyer of Nature Kukuruznik and the Water Thief Dike Kokaral.

The Coptic faith is an ancient Christian church, dating back to millennia before the Event according to its practitioners. After the Event, instability in Egypt forced the Coptic Papacy in Alexandria to confederate with the Ethiopian Orthodox Church and move the seat of the Papacy south to Ethiopia. Coptic practitioners long for the day when the Papacy can move back to Alexandria.

Native to antediluvian England, the Anglican Church has long since been practically extinct in its homeland. It regards itself as a 'via media' or middle way between Protestantism and Catholicism. Its religious head is the king of England. Though barely extant in the British Isles it is not impossible for it to return to its former glory.

Originating among Neo-Hussite theologians in Prague after the Event, the Utraquist faith gradually became its own. Having been persecuted by their Catholic overlords for heresy, the Utraquists were driven underground as a faith. However, this persecution only emboldened them more, as many members began preaching secretly in the countryside towns of Central Europe. As a goal, the Utraquists seek to create their own domain, and are eager to spread their beliefs far and wide.

Zaidiyyah, occasionally known as Fiver Shias, is one of the Shia sects closest in terms of theology to the Ibadi and Mutazila schools. Zaidiyyah emerged in the eighth century from Shi'a Islam. Zaidis are named after Zayd ibn Ali, the grandson of Husayn ibn Ali and the son of the fourth Imam Ali ibn 'Husain. Following the event it has attempted to consolidate its position in Yemen in an effort to protect itself during this era of tribulation.

The Ismaili Shi'ites are those who accept Isma'il ibn Jafar as the legitimate successor to Imam Ja'far al-Sadiq, unlike the mainstream Twelver Shias, who accept his younger brother Musa al-Kadhim. Historically, the Ismailis reached the peak of their political power in the age long before the Event, with the Fatimid Caliphate. However, in the intervening centuries, they have dwindled somewhat, being further subdivided into sects. In the chaos of the Event, many Ismaili sects have been absorbed by others, and now most Ismailis accept the Aga Khan as their lord. Theologically, Ismailis tend to be more focused on the interior, mystical elements of Islam than are Twelvers.

Originating in the split between those who supported Ali as the successor to Muhammad and those who supported Abu Bakr, Shia Islam is the second largest grouping of Muslims in the world. The overwhelmingly dominant school of Shia thought is the Jafari, or "Twelver" school, holding that there exist Twelve divinely-ordained Imams, with the Twelfth and final Imam having been divinely hidden from the world since the tenth century, and who will return as the promised Mahdi at the end of time. Nowadays, unlike the Sunnis, there is no unifying Caliph figure among Shia Muslims, so they follow the guidance of powerful and influential Imams of major realms.

The main doctrine of Budaism is that the "Buddha" was not a prince from India, but rather the same person as Buda (or in some texts Bleda), the brother of Attila the Hun. He is believed to have traveled to India after his enlightenment and abdication to his brother. Most of its religious traditions are similar to the Vajrayana school of Buddhism, however it includes some practices that other Buddhists consider pagan.

Egypt has since antediluvian times been a bastion of the Islamic faith, and usually, whomever ruled Egypt was one of the premier powers of the Islamic world, and it is still home to the Al-Azhar University, the premier centre of Islamic learning. Given this importance, the recent incursions by infidels into Egypt have been an intolerable insult to the faithful. In opposition to this outrage, a band of pious warriors have baned together, vowing to dedicate themselves to the fight against the infidel.
A threat to Israel - we must keep an eye on them

Ever since Paulius Juze overthrew the pagan Mindaugasid dynasty centuries ago, Lithuania has been a strong bastion of Catholicism, with the old pagan religion snuffed out so thoroughly that it was difficult to practice it even in private. However, the recent fall of Lithuania to infidels has disgusted many of the zealous locals, who have banded together in an attempt to defend the faith. The new group calls itself 'The Purifiers' as a reference to Paulius Juze's nickname, "Purifier of Lithuania", and promise to fight unbelief everywhere, but especially in Eastern Europe.

Yarsani faith comes from the northwest region of Iran and northern Iraq, it has roots in indigenous Persian faiths like Zoroastrianism, to whom they are closely related. Yarsani believe in the reincarnation of the soul, but also of God, and that in each Epoch there are seven Haftan who accompany God on earth in mortal form. The Last Major presence of God on Earth was Soltan Sahak, who is said to have been born from his virgin mother, and when he grew of age he instructed the Kurdish tribes in the dogma of Yarsan. With the collapse of the world order, the Yarsani have declared it to be the fifth epoch, no longer bound to their mountain lands they strike forth in their search for the next incarnation of God.

The Alawites are an ethnoreligious group primarily in the Levant which originated from Shia Islam. The Alawites revere Ali ibn Abi Talib, considered the first Imam of the Twelver school. The group is believed to have been founded by Ibn Nusayr during the 9th century. Ibn Nusayr was a disciple of the tenth Twelver Imam, Ali al-Hadi and of the eleventh Twelver Imam, Hasan al-Askari. For this reason, Alawites are also called Nusayris. Another name, Ansari, is believed to be a mistransliteration of "Nusayri". In game they are represented as a Druze heresy due to the similarities between the two religions.

The faith which arose in West Africa post event is a syncretic mix of the native Vodun traditions and the Islamic faith which had held sway over other parts of the region. In this faith, translated as "The faith of the Angels", God's servants have power to intercede in our world on both his behalf and our own. These angels include figures such as Sakpata, Jo and Legba. Legba acting primarily as the guardian of the entrance to heaven for example. While they often remain in heaven, on occasionally they will come to earth.

The Ovlatii faith is a recent split from mainstream Islam. Founded by Sufi Sheikhs who injected their faith into the local ancestor worship back during the age of the Rashidun Caliphs. The Ovlats are tribes descended from the Prophet Muhammad through one of the Four Caliphs. Because of their belief in the sacred origin and spiritual powers of the Ovlat representatives, Turks of central Asia accord these tribes a special, holy status. They attended and conferred blessings on all important communal and life-cycle events, and also acted as mediators between clans and tribes. Many of the Turkmen who are revered for their spiritual powers trace their lineage to an Ovlat, and such individuals to be present at life-cycle and other communal celebrations.

The concept of "sisu" has always been integral to life in Finland. Outsiders consider them nothing more than a disciplined people, but to Finns that discipline is just one of many things necessary to attain good sisu. Sisu is a life force that is innate to all living beings, and it forms a scale with a fragile balance. On one end, bad sisu will make a man corrupted and infirm, while good sisu will give that same man inhuman strength and combat prowess. Upon death, one's sisu will determine whether they ascend to Ylijumala's realm as a deity themselves, or fall into manala and be cursed to suffer for eternity. As an example, Sisuists believe that the Marshal was able to defend Finland against invaders for decades without losing vigor thanks to his good standing in life, while the wicked Lord Stalin was turned into a frail madman as a result of stealing divinity, becoming a cursed god worshipped only by the insane.

The "Igreja Romariana", or "Romarian Church" is the legal successor to the Catholic church of Brazil. After the chaos of the Event, many Brazilians abandoned the Church, believing that Rome is gone, and with it the Pope. A small, but dedicated number of Sedevacantist Catholics held out, believing the Pope was simply too far to contact. Centuries passed, and the Romarian Church became the dominant Christian faith in most of Brazil, having absorbed many schismatic churches that rejected the Pope in Rome. It only grew to widespread prominence when the kings of Rio de Janeiro, Sao Paulo, Espírito Santo and the dukes of Alagoas, Rio Grande do Norte and Sergipe agreed to adopt it as part of their temporary alliance. By 2555, contact with Rome has been reestablished, and the Patriarch of Aparecida sits as the formal head of Brazilian Catholicism as contacting the Pope in Rome requires a perilous journey across the Atlantic. All adherents east of the Atlantic Ocean answer to the Archbishop of Cabo Verde, who in turn serves as the intermediary between the Pope and the Patriarch. Romarians reject the Sevillian Pope, believing him to be yet another schismatic like the ones that were struck  down in Brazil many years before.

Less of a religion and more of a philosophy, the Way represents the Blorg ideals of Fanatic Xenophilia and Militarism. Having been heavily influenced by human culture during the formative years of their civilization, the Blorg hold great respect for the native cultures of Earth.

Nupolona-kolon (roughly meaning "Elder's Teachings") is the umbrella term of the syncretized system of Liberian native beliefs and Protestant Christianity widespread in Liberia. Most Nupolona-kolon faithful follow either the more native focused Old Ways or the more Christian influenced New Ways.

Ahl-e Haqq, which translates loosely to the people of truth, is a movement within Yarsanism to move closer to Islam and adapt to the political climate of the middle east. However, this movement did not go unnoticed, branded heretics by the mainline faith or Yarsani, they distance themselves from their puritanical parent faith on the path of reformism.

Charismatics are not known as such because of their charm, but rather their belief in 'charismata', gifts of the Holy Spirit manifested in miracles and signs that can be endowed simply by baptism and faith in the Holy Spirit. Such wonders include the ability to speak in tongues, miraculous healing of the cripples, gifts of prophecy and more events often considered 'supernatural'. In the Old World, Charismatic churches are found on the far eastern Ryukuan Islands, along with smaller congregations in port cities habited by Amejo merchants.

Bön is the ancient indigenous pre-Buddhist religion of Tibet. It is shamanistic and animistic in nature with multiple deities. After the introduction of Buddhism to Tibet, Bön adopted many of its elements. It has perserved through the event and the centuries after in a number of communities protected from the event by the Thunder Dragon Empire and in several valleys throughout Tibet.

Bön is the ancient indigenous pre-Buddhist religion of Tibet. It is shamanistic and animistic in nature with multiple deities. After the introduction of Buddhism to Tibet, Bön adopted many of its elements. It has perserved through the event and the centuries after in a number of communities protected from the event by the Thunder Dragon Empire and in several valleys throughout Tibet. The reformed Bön faith has fully incorporated some of its Buddhists elements while codifying the shamanic and animistic deities followed by its worshipers in a series of detailed scriptures.
Fervour is a representation of the devotion of this character to the Satanael and the Einblicker Faith, making him more respected especially by the clergy.

For the people living in the arctic wastes of Russia, there are few things to find besides the night sky and the marvelous stellar bodies that inhabit it. So it comes as no surprise that a number of folktales and traditions have sprung up surrounding the myths relating to the sky and the stars.
